page.title: 11Education
page.content: There are at present four infant teachers with two reception classes of about 19 children each,aged from four and a half to five plus.The other two top infant classes have about 25 children each,aged 6 plus. The infants spend their mornings learning the basic skills.Mathemathics is learned with the use of natural objects such conkers, beads and fircones.Each classroom has a sand tray for weighing and measuring, and a water tray where simple science experiments can take place.Coloured wooden blocks in units, tens, and hundreds are used for the early stages of number work. There are several reading schemes, but the main scheme is Beacon. Flash cards are used and much time is spent on hearing children read and in the learning of phonics.
